content:
Client: C2
Developer: Cyril Lonsido

Issue: Cy was asking if it’s possible to be transferred to another client. no concerns on tasks but more on the work environment. He is trying to work through it since he knows he is the only resource there now since En has left but sometimes it tends to get tedious since he feels like Viktor is still not listening and forcing his unconventional approach with the project. Cy assured us he will still hang on but would like to check if ever if there are opportunity for him to be transferred in case the work environment get more toxic.

Suggestions for developer: Encourage Cyril to continue communicating his concerns and work with management to identify ways to improve the work environment, as well as any training or upskilling opportunities that may help him succeed in his current role.
Suggestions for client: Work with management to address concerns and identify ways to improve the work environment for all employees.
Action items: HR management to schedule a meeting with Cyril to discuss his concerns and identify potential solutions, while also exploring the possibility of a transfer if necessary.

Suggestions for Storma: Offer employee wellness programs, regular check-ins with management, and a clear process for addressing employee concerns to help foster a positive work environment.

Client: BlueFrog
Developer: Paul Gravos

Issue: Paul mentioned he is getting some back end tasks ever since Jasper has left. he does not mind but also like to further prepare himself on this by taking in proper training/workshop. he is also inquiring if BlueFrog will find a replacement for Jasper as it will help especially on the back end part of the project.

Suggestions for developer: Encourage Paul to pursue any relevant training or upskilling opportunities that may help him succeed in his current role, and offer support in identifying such opportunities.
Suggestions for client: Explore the possibility of finding a replacement for Jasper and provide support for Paul's desire to further develop his skills.
Action items: HR management to explore potential training or upskilling opportunities for Paul, and work with BlueFrog management to identify a replacement for Jasper if necessary.

Suggestions for Storma: Offer ongoing training and upskilling opportunities for employees, as well as incentives for continued personal and professional growth.

Client: Pastest
Developer: John Gela

Issue: John Gela will be working on a new project involving Angular, but has only basic knowledge and is inquiring about formal training/workshops.

Suggestions for developer: Encourage John to pursue any relevant training or upskilling opportunities that may help him succeed in his current role, and offer support in identifying such opportunities.
Suggestions for client: Provide support for John's desire to further develop his skills, including identifying relevant training or upskilling opportunities.
Action items: HR management to explore potential training or upskilling opportunities for John, and work with Pastest management to identify any resources or support needed to facilitate his success in the new project.

Suggestions for Storma: Offer ongoing training and upskilling opportunities for employees, as well as support in identifying and pursuing relevant educational opportunities.

Client: Knights Absorb
Developer: Joshua Osillo

Issue: Joshua is working on the booking application for the mobile development team, but has turned over the mobile projects to Greg as it is not his forte.

Suggestions for developer: Encourage Joshua to continue working on the booking application and to seek out any relevant training or upskilling opportunities that may help him improve his skills in this area.
Suggestions for client: Provide support for Joshua in his efforts to improve his skills and explore the possibility of assigning him to projects that align more closely with his strengths.
Action items: HR management to explore potential training or upskilling opportunities for Joshua, and work with Knights Absorb management to identify any alternative projects
